content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.83 - Executive order no. 83: establishing the jackie robinson empire state freedom medal and the jackie robinson empire state freedom medal commission

State Regulations
WHEREAS, a compelling need exists to recognize individuals
for their outstanding accomplishments, dedication and commitment toward the
betterment of New York State; WHEREAS, Jack "Jackie" Roosevelt Robinson was such an
outstanding individual; WHEREAS, Jackie Robinson entered major league baseball on

April 15, 1947 as a Brooklyn Dodger; WHEREAS, Jackie Robinson demonstrated amazing strength and
fortitude by pioneering the integration of professional baseball and
challenging the deeply rooted color barriers of segregation in America; WHEREAS, Jackie Robinson was a champion of civil rights, justice and freedom for all Americans; WHEREAS, Jackie Robinson based his life on the fundamental
characteristics of honesty, courage, determination, integrity and commitment
for a better society; and
WHEREAS, Jackie Robinson's undaunted pursuit of excellence
and reverence toward his fellow man embodies the spirit of New York

State; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby create the Jackie Robinson Empire

State Freedom Medal and the Jackie Robinson Empire State Freedom Medal

Commission (the "Commission"). I. Membership of the Commission
1. The

Commission shall be comprised of no less than five members selected by the

Governor. 2. The members of the

Commission shall receive no compensation but shall be entitled to reimbursement
for any necessary expenses incurred in connection with the performance of their
duties. Service on the Commission shall not constitute public employment for
purposes of disqualification from holding public office or
employment. II. Responsibilities of the Commission
1. The

Commission shall solicit and accept nominations from all sources across the

State and periodically convene in order to review such nominations. Annually, after evaluating all nominees based on the criteria set forth below, the

Commission shall submit a list of medal nominees to the Governor and an account
of their backgrounds, character and accomplishments. From the list, the

Governor shall select one or more individuals to receive the Jackie Robinson

Empire State Freedom Medal. 2. In
making its selection of nominees for the Jackie Robinson Empire State Freedom

Medal, the Commission shall utilize the following criteria which best exemplify
the life and attributes of Jackie Robinson: honesty, courage, leadership, determination, integrity and commitment to the betterment of society. 3. The Commission is hereby authorized to
call upon the Department of State to provide such administrative support and
assistance as is necessary to carry out its activities and effectuate the
purpose of this Order. 4. Every

State department, agency, division, board, bureau, commission and other entity
over which I have executive power shall also provide assistance and cooperation
to the Commission. Signed: George E. PatakiDated: July 1, 1998
